3.13.0.0.message: Enabled at-rest keyring encryption for sensitive fields in AI Azure Content Safety plugin.

Added support for the global `tls_certificate_verify` option.
When enabled globally via `kong.conf`, the plugin's `ssl_verify` config field cannot be set to `false`.
This ensures SSL/TLS certificate verification cannot be disabled when global security policy requires it.

3.12.0.0.message: Added response guard to filter AI responses for safety and compliance.
Fixed the plugin to work with multi-modal content.

3.11.0.0.message: AI Azure Content Safety: Fixed an issue where Blocklist breaches are not correctly parsed.

If any [AI Gateway plugin](/plugins/?category=ai) has been enabled in a self-managed Kong Gateway deployment for more than a week, upgrades from 3.10 versions to 3.11.0.0 will fail due to a license migration issue. This does not affect Konnect deployments.

A fix will be provided in 3.11.0.1.

See [breaking changes in 3.11](/gateway/breaking-changes/#known-issues-in-3-11-0-0) for a temporary workaround.

3.11.0.1.message: Fixed an issue where the llm license migration could fail if the license counter contained more than one week of data.

3.10.0.4.message: AI Azure Content Safety: Fixed an issue where Blocklist breaches are not correctly parsed.

3.7.0.0.message:
Adds a new plugin that allows the Kong administrator to enforce 
that all AI-Proxy requests must be introspected with the Azure Content Safety service.

The plugin enables configurable thresholds for the different moderation categories, 
and reports audit results into the Kong log serializer for reporting purposes.
